item.title: Cairn launches January 29, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5

Available in standard and Deluxe editions.

Survival climbing adventure game Cairn will launch for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam on January 29, 2026 for $29.99 with an additional 10 percent launch discount, developer The Game Bakers announced. A $36.99 Deluxe Edition will also be available, featuring a Kami travel guide by comic book artist Mathieu Bablet and three exclusive keepsakes from Aava’s journey.

Here is an overview of the game, via The Game Bakers:

About

Reach a summit never climbed before in this survival-climber from the creators of Furi and Haven. Plan your route carefully and climb anywhere, managing pitons and resources to survive unforgiving Mount Kami. Discover what Aava is willing to sacrifice to achieve the ascent of a lifetime.

With approximately 15 hours of playtime, Cairn seeks to capture both the exhilaration of the ascent and the solitude that comes with it, as Aava leaves behind her family, friends, and the world below. Along the climb, players will meet fellow mountaineers and uncover Kami’s hidden past—the footprints of earlier expeditions and the remnants of a long-forgotten troglodyte culture. The narrative is supported by nearly an hour of cinematic cutscenes featuring a cast of ten actors, highlighting Aava’s passion for the mountains.

Key Features

  • Realistic Climbing Simulation – Cairn‘s realistic simulation allows intuitive climbing: find the best holds and place your hands and feet seamlessly with simple controls. Adapt your posture, effort and balance—if you’re not careful, you will fall!
  • The Ascent of a Lifetime – As pro climber Aava, you embark on the ascent of Mount Kami, a summit that has never been reached. Along the journey, meet unexpected companions and hear from those left on the ground. Discover the mountain’s history and decide what Aava is willing to sacrifice to achieve her dream.
  • Open Your Own Route – You are free to climb anywhere. Explore the mountain, read the rock face from the ground and plan your route carefully to reach the top. Solve problems while on the wall to navigate difficult sections. You can climb on anything, so choose your path wisely!
  • Climbing is a Fight – Climbing is challenging: each wall feels like a boss fight. A thrilling challenge for those eager to test themselves, but you can also adjust the difficulty to customize your experience.
  • Survive the Deadly Mountain – Manage your resources to survive during the long ascent: pitons, chalk, finger tape… but also food, water and medicine. Set up bivouacs and explore the mountain to find resources to reach the summit.
  • Endless Replayability – In Expedition mode, choose Aava or Marco and attack different mountains your way: select your climbing style (alpine, free solo) and challenges to take on. Compare your performance with other climbers.
  • Award-Winning Indie Team – An unforgettable experience from the makers of Furi and Haven, with music and sound design by the team behind Limbo, Inside, Control and Cocoon, and art and story by renowned comic-book artist Mathieu Bablet.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: MIO: Memories in Orbit adds Switch 2 version, launches January 20, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Last-gen versions seemingly no longer planned.

Science-fiction Metroidvania MIO: Memories in Orbit will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on January 20, 2025, publisher Focus Entertainment and developer Douze Dixiemes announced. The Switch 2 version is newly announced, and the previously announced PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and Switch versions are seemingly no longer planned.

Here is an overview of the game and demo, via Focus Entertainment:

A Mesmerizing Journey Across Danger and Wonder

Play as MIO, a nimble robot who awakens alone aboard the Vessel—a vast, drifting spaceship left in ruin. Once maintained by AI caretakers known as the Pearls, the Vessel is now overrun by wild vegetation and malfunctioning machines. With the ship facing imminent shutdown, MIO must explore its labyrinthine depths, recover its lost memories, and uncover the truth behind the collapse… and their own forgotten past.

Today’s trailer shows how MIO: Memories In Orbit‘s multi-tool gameplay combines platforming and combat in an ongoing, empowering flow. As a voice narrates elements from a mysterious lore, MIO: Memories In Orbit‘s trailer exudes a poetic atmosphere, stemming from stunning art direction and inspirations, both visual (science-fiction, comics, anime, paintings) and musical (lo-fi beats and choral melodies).

Start the Journey Now With a Playable Demo

MIO: Memories In Orbit‘s PC demo is two-to-three hours long and lets you play the beginning of the game, with a secret area to discover and a major challenge to overcome. Experience a slice of action-platforming and exploration gameplay featuring precision-based traversal using the grappling hook, gliding, and wall-cling. Will you rise to the challenge and save the Vessel from destruction?

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Rogue Point ‘WTF is Rogue Point?’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC

A classic shooter with a modern twist.

Publisher Team17 and Black Mesa developer Crowbar Collective have released a new trailer for four-player cooperative first-person shooter Rogue Point, dubbed “WTF is Rogue Point?”

Here is an overview of the game, via Team17:

About

Rogue Point is a cooperative shooter by Crowbar Collective, the team behind the hit Half-Life 2 mod, Black Mesa. Easy to pick up and even easier to say yes to one more mission. Hard to master and yet harder to not enjoy blowing stuff up with your friends. Throw grenades, peep under doors, carve up a giant pig man, strategize your approach, or just Leeroy Jenkins the whole plan.

When the richest CEO on Earth dies, cutthroat conglomerates vie to carve up his kingdom. Using the MERX app, businessmen order mercenary armies like takeout. Only Rogue Point, an elite vigilante squad, dares to fight back.

Rogue Point wants players to enjoy the rush of a good old-fashioned first-person shooter and the thrill of pulling off pre-game tactics successfully, without dealing with microtransactions and mess (apart from whatever is left of your enemies when you’re done).

Key Features

  • Fight and Maneuver Your Way Through Missions Spread Across Four Diverse Locations – The Airport, the Mall, the Office, and the Oilrig. Each map is reshaped by the game’s Parametric Design System, offering new strategies and challenges with every play.
  • Choose From Five Different MERX Classes, Each With Their Own Unique Playstyle – Soldier, Berserker, Sniper, Heavy, and the 5-Star Mercenary, dangerous and legendary MERX have received the top-tier 5-star rating in the app.
  • Cooperative Teamplay Work Together to Battle Against the MERX Threat – Rogue Point is purpose-built to reinforce teamplay and pull players into combat. Plan, adapt, and overcome the odds by building your unique Rogue.
  • Weapons and Customization – Earn money to buy weapons and gear. Buy the exact loadout you want or put your cash on the line for a chance at rare items only available through the Dead Drop system:
    • Over 20 weapons, with multiple skins.
    • Over 40 tactical items and attachments for your arsenal.
    • Over 60 cosmetic items, with multiple skins.
    • 24 mission layouts, across four locations.

Rogue Point will be available for PC via Steam. A release date has yet to be announced.

Watch the trailer below.

item.title: Carmageddon: Rogue Shift launches in early 2026 for PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC
item.content:encoded:
About

The legendary Carmageddon engine roars back to life, reimagined for a new era of vehicular combat.

Carmageddon smashes back with brutal roguelite vehicular‑combat mayhem. Adapt, upgrade, and unleash destruction on post‑apocalyptic zombie hordes. The legacy lives on, reinvented and unforgiving.

The Long Night

The year is 2050, and the world you know is a post‑apocalyptic wasteland.

Hordes of nightmare creatures, the Wasted, lay siege to humanity. Every night, the streets are overrun, forcing everyone to barricade themselves in their skyscraper-homes for survival.

There is just one chance to escape all this: the Carmageddon.

These deadly races promise power, prestige, and valuable prizes to the participants. Most importantly, the champion wins the right to attempt the perilous journey that leads to the spaceport beyond the mountains. The only one left, the only chance to flee this dying world.

You enter the Carmageddon as one of countless racers, equipped with little more than a rust bucket, scavenged fuel, and a makeshift weapon. You’ll face off against rival gangs like the Autoscum and other rogues in a fight for survival. Each destruction race is an opportunity to win parts and upgrades, a step towards the ultimate escape.

As the night descends, the Wasted take the streets, and you with them.

Drive to Survive

The original Carmageddon spirit of vehicular mayhem has been refined and redesigned. We looked at the past and the present to create a visceral, fast and accessible form of combat racing.

  • 15 Upgradeable Vehicles – FWD, RWD, and AWD, each with unique weight and suspension
  • Metal‑on‑Metal Car Combat – Crash, shove, boost and side‑bash rivals
  • 13 Weapon Classes – From shotguns to railguns, all fully upgradable
  • Over 80 Perks – Craft outrageous synergies for destruction racing supremacy
  • Dynamic Weather and Day‑Night Cycle – Rain slicks the tarmac, fog shrouds ambushes
  • Elite and Boss Events – Colossal war‑rigs, corrupted Enforcers, and endless zombie hordes
  • Extensive Visual Damage Model – Windshields, hood, doors, bumpers and trunk lid will bend, crumple, hang and detach.

The Roguelite Campaign

Every Campaign run offers a unique journey through a randomly generated graph.

Win Events and smash opponents to gain Credits. Maneuvers such as killing Wasteds, drifts, jumps, and flicks also grant rewards.

Strategically plan your route so you can reach Shops. In these safe havens you can repair your car, swap weapons, or install one of the 80+ unlockable perks.

Adapt to the dynamically increasing difficulty and conquer elite events and bosses.

With branching paths, varied objectives, and ever-changing time-of-day and weather conditions, no two runs are the same.

But the Carmageddon ain’t over when your vehicle is wrecked. Another driver will step up, and the challenge will resume anew, in a typical roguelite loop. Earn Beatcoins to unlock permanent bonuses and new content between runs in the Black Market. Find synergies between these elements to create the ultimate killing machine: the Carmageddon never ends.

Opponents

The Carmageddon hosts a diverse assembly of marauders, rejects, and lowlifes. Some prefer to rush in front of the pack. Others will chase you and try to bash you out of the way. Some will wait for the chance to unload their weapons into your car. Some are more skilled or better prepared than others. You may recognize some familiar names in the crowd.

Corrupt police forces known as the Enforcers impose their brutal rules on those spared from mutation. The Enforcers will force you off the road to strip your car for spare parts and ammo, if you let them.

Each area of the city is controlled by a particularly fierce opponent, commonly known as “the Boss”. These are the biggest, baddest, fastest, more armed vehicles that you can find. The rules of the Carmageddon demand that you beat each Boss before advancing to the next stage.

Every race is a brutal test of skill, demanding you master driving, melee, and ranged attacks against a diverse and unpredictable roster of foes. To do so, you must work on your car, find upgrades and weapons that combine well together, and consistently perform behind the wheel.

The Wasted

The Third World War and a series of devastating natural disasters left Earth in ruins. Amidst the chaos, a food supplement called MiVis was introduced to address food shortages, and became a ubiquitous part of daily life.

However, long-term consumption of MiVis led to a horrific cellular mutation, transforming people into Wasted – monstrous, empty husks consumed by the supplement’s side effects.

Now, they have become a mass of unsentient, super-aggressive beings that threaten survivors as soon as the sun starts to set.

A lone Wasted is no match for your chariot of fury. Things start to heat up when more Wasteds show up. Boost into the hordes of humanoid husks swarming the track, parting the waves of Wasted like a Moses on wheels! But be careful not to get stuck in the high tide: too many Wasteds will surround your car and smash it to bits with the remains of their raw hands.

And then there are Special Wasteds… horrible supermutations of the Wasted, morphed into something even less human.

They may explode, shoot you from a distance, lunge at your car, or produce even nastier surprises.

They pose a real danger and tend to show up late at night.

And then, there’s the ultimate abomination. A creature whispered about, rarely seen; the monster that guards the only mountain pass towards salvation, and your final challenge.

item.title: ‘Samurai space opera’ action RPG SOL Shogunate announced for consoles, PC
item.content:encoded:
Chaos Manufacturing, a studio founded by “veteran developers with decades of experience working on a wide range of acclaimed game franchises,” has announced SOL Shogunate a “samurai space opera” action RPG coming to unspecified consoles and PC via Steam in 2027.

“With our debut SOL Shogunate, we’re realizing our vision for the first samurai space opera, which brings fluid, spectacle-driven combat to a sci-fi universe that pays homage to the majesty of feudal Japanese tradition,” said Chaos Manufacturing CEO Guy Costantini in a press release. “We’re fusing combat, story, and music into an experience that we hope players will find thrilling, emotional, and unforgettable.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via Chaos Manufacturing:

About

SOL Shogunate is a “samurai space opera” that invites players to an alt-future version of our solar system where the way of the sword is law. In this single-player third-person action RPG, humanity has spread across the planets under the dominion of a Shogunate whose grip on power is about to be challenged. Take on the role of Yuzuki, the shattered heir of a once-powerful samurai family massacred by a rival clan, as you transform into an outlaw ronin and set out on a pulse-pounding, blood-soaked path of retribution.

Key Features

  • Unrelenting Samurai Action – Choose from multiple weapon types, each with unique fighting styles and deadly capabilities, to destroy enemies from afar or up close and personal.
  • Transcending Flesh and Steel – Infuse your weapon of choice with different elemental effects to give yourself an edge in combat, and collect gene splices to customize unique skills that suit your approach to combat. From bio-ceramic skin to enhanced vision, upgrade and evolve into the ultimate weapon.
  • The Moon As You’ve Never Seen It – Explore the gleaming artificial gravity-creating metropolises of the moon—each an homage to a revered era in Japanese history and a symbol of the SOL Shogunate‘s dominion over the solar system. Trek across the lunar surface astride a mechanized steed or monocycle. Traverse the magnificent astro-feudal biomes using gravity assist gear and uncover the secrets of a long-forgotten war.
  • Monumental Boss Fights – Tackle dynamic, cinematic, multiphase boss encounters that challenge you to identify and exploit weaknesses. Music evolves as battles intensify, featuring dynamic tracks hand-crafted for thrilling SOL Shogunate battles by talented recording artists including Japanese rock band AliA with more artists to be revealed in the future.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.
